connector.description:
Stores JSON-formatted data into ElasticSearch.

The input data must be formatted in JSON according to the requirements of the index. 

If you specify the `certificate` property, you must base64 encode it before you pass it as a parameter.

In the header, you can set the following properties:

- `indexId` / `ce-indexid`: The index ID for ElasticSearch.

- `indexName` / `ce-indexname`: The index name for ElasticSearch.

If you do not set a property in the header, the Kamelet uses the exchange ID for the index setting.

camel.kamelet.elasticsearch-index-sink.u.name: camel.kamelet.elasticsearch-index-sink.user
camel.kamelet.elasticsearch-index-sink.u.description: The username to connect to ElasticSearch.

camel.kamelet.elasticsearch-index-sink.p.name: camel.kamelet.elasticsearch-index-sink.password
camel.kamelet.elasticsearch-index-sink.p.description: The password to connect to ElasticSearch.

camel.kamelet.elasticsearch-index-sink.e.name: camel.kamelet.elasticsearch-index-sink.enableSSL
camel.kamelet.elasticsearch-index-sink.e.description: Specifies to connect by using SSL.

camel.kamelet.elasticsearch-index-sink.h.name: camel.kamelet.elasticsearch-index-sink.hostAddresses
camel.kamelet.elasticsearch-index-sink.h.description: A comma-separated list of remote transport addresses in `ip:port format`. Example: quickstart-es-http:9200

camel.kamelet.elasticsearch-index-sink.c.name: camel.kamelet.elasticsearch-index-sink.clusterName
camel.kamelet.elasticsearch-index-sink.c.description: The name of the ElasticSearch cluster. Example: quickstart

camel.kamelet.elasticsearch-index-sink.i.name: camel.kamelet.elasticsearch-index-sink.indexName
camel.kamelet.elasticsearch-index-sink.i.description: The name of the ElasticSearch index. Example: data

camel.kamelet.elasticsearch-index-sink.c.name: camel.kamelet.elasticsearch-index-sink.certificate
camel.kamelet.elasticsearch-index-sink.c.description: The Certificate for accessing the Elasticsearch cluster. You must encode this value in base64.
